H0.text: Stomach is the organ where digestion of proteins begins with acids.

H1.text: Colon is the organ where digestion of proteins begins with acids.

H2.text: The liver is the organ where digestion of proteins begins with acids.

H3.text: Brain is the organ where digestion of proteins begins with acids.

A4.text: The stomach releases proteases (protein-digesting enzymes such as pepsin), and hydrochloric acid, which kills or inhibits bacteria and provides the acidic pH of 2 for the proteases to work.
